poem:
"An Ode to Pedestrian Freedom"

In the pulse of cities,
Oh, walkers and cyclists,
ministers muse your movement -
for wealth, wellness, liberty,
apart from the path of vehicles, 
their voracious claim on land.
Be the new architects,
drawing lines of silent speed,
your feet, an antidote to crisis,
plaintive as the tread of rain
nudging the pavement,
blunt and sweet.
